Name: Election Manager Act
Content:
Summary Of This Act
This act is for the general procedure of senate elections and the manager which will be doing them


















1. Election Manager
   1. The election manager is appointed by the Senate with a simple majority RCV vote
      1. If the senate does not exist it can be appointed by the Emperor 
   2. If unable to fulfill their duties, the election manager may request that the President or Emperor propose a temporary replacement or if there is no sign of activity from the election manager 2 days prior to any scheduled elections a temporary replacement would be forced.
   3. An election manager can be impeached by having a vote for a new election manager.
2. Responsibilities
   1. Manage Senate elections in districts as well as snap votes for Senators in districts.
      1. No other individual is allowed to post the link of a Senate election vote outside of the district chat where the election is occuring.
      2. Posting a link of a Senate election outside of the district chat where an election is occurring is subject to a fine, barring from voting in the election, barring from running in the election, and/or impeachment.
   2. Manage Presidential elections if they are public
   3. The election manager will make sure these elections happen according to times specifies in the constitution
